maml:description.maml:para: Create or update the Steam Web API config file.
Create or update the Steam Web API config file which contains the API key used to authenticate to those Steam Web API's that require authentication.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to Connect-SteamAPI.
None. Nothing is returned when calling Connect-SteamAPI.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: sysgoblin (https://github.com/sysgoblin) and Frederik Hjorslev Nylander

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts the user for a Steam Web API key and sets the specified input within the config file.

maml:description.maml:para: Find a Steam AppID by searching the name of the application.
Find a Steam AppID by searching the name of the application.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the name of the application. If multiple hits the user will be presented with an Out-GridView where he/she can choose the correct application.
Enter the name of the application. If multiple hits the user will be presented with an Out-GridView where he/she can choose the correct application.

dev:type.maml:name: System.String. Find-SteamAppID accepts a string value.
System.String and Int. It returns the application name and application ID.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Will results in multiple hits and let the user choose between the application 'Ground Branch' which is the game or 'Ground Branch Dedicated Server' which is the dedicated server to 'Ground Branch'.
This Will only yield one result which is 'Ground Branch Dedicated Server'. Output is the AppID and name of the application.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the friend list of any Steam user.
Returns the friend list of any Steam user, provided their Steam Community profile visibility is set to "Public".

maml:Description.maml:para: 64 bit Steam ID to return friend list for.
Relationship filter. Possibles values: all, friend.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.
64 bit Steam ID to return friend list for.
Relationship filter. Possibles values: all, friend.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a string that is either formatted as json, xml or vdf.
The user's friends list, as an array of friends. Nothing will be returned
In the array, the following three properties are returned:
- steamid: 64 bit Steam ID of the friend.
- friend_since: Unix timestamp of the time when the relationship was created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Outputs the user's friends list, as an array of friends.
Outputs the user's friends list, as an array of friends and converts it from Json to PSCustomObjects.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the latest news of a game specified by its AppID.
Returns the latest news of a game specified by its AppID.

maml:Description.maml:para: AppID of the game you want the news of.
How many news entries you want to get returned.
Maximum length of each news entry.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.
AppID of the game you want the news of.
How many news entries you want to get returned.
Maximum length of each news entry.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a string that is either formatted as json, xml or vdf.
appid, the AppID of the game you want news of
newsitems, an array of news item information:
- A shortened excerpt of the contents (to maxlength characters), terminated by "..." if longer than maxlength.
- A comma-separated string of labels and UNIX timestamp.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists number of news that are available for the AppID.
Retrieves 1 (the latest) news item for the AppID 440.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns Community, VAC, and Economy ban statuses for given players.
Returns Community, VAC, and Economy ban statuses for given players.

maml:Description.maml:para: Comma-delimited list of 64 bit Steam IDs to return player ban information for.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.
Comma-delimited list of 64 bit Steam IDs to return player ban information for.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a string that is either formatted as json, xml or vdf.
players: List of player ban objects for each 64 bit ID requested
- CommunityBanned (bool) Indicates whether or not the player is banned from Steam Community.
- VACBanned (bool) Indicates whether or not the player has VAC bans on record.
- NumberOfVACBans (int) Number of VAC bans on record.
- DaysSinceLastBan (int) Number of days since the last ban.
- NumberOfGameBans (int) Number of bans in games, this includes CS:GO Overwatch bans.
- EconomyBan (string) The player's ban status in the economy. If the player has no bans on record the string will be "none", if the player is on probation it will say "probation", etc.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns basic profile information for a list of 64-bit Steam IDs.
Returns basic profile information for a list of 64-bit Steam IDs.

maml:Description.maml:para: Comma-delimited list of 64 bit Steam IDs to return profile information for. Up to 100 Steam IDs can be requested.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.
Comma-delimited list of 64 bit Steam IDs to return profile information for. Up to 100 Steam IDs can be requested.
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a string that is either formatted as json, xml or vdf.
Some data associated with a Steam account may be hidden if the user has their
profile visibility set to "Friends Only" or "Private". In that case, only
- personaname: The player's persona name (display name)
- profileurl: The full URL of the player's Steam Community profile.
- avatar: The full URL of the player's 32x32px avatar. If the user hasn't configured an avatar, this will be the default ? avatar.
- avatarmedium: The full URL of the player's 64x64px avatar. If the user hasn't configured an avatar, this will be the default ? avatar.
- avatarfull: The full URL of the player's 184x184px avatar. If the user hasn't configured an avatar, this will be the default ? avatar.

- personastate: The user's current status. 0 - Offline, 1 - Online, 2 - Busy, 3 - Away, 4 - Snooze, 5 - looking to trade, 6 - looking to play. If the player's profile is private, this will always be "0", except if the user has set their status to looking to trade or looking to play, because a bug makes those status appear even if the profile is private.

- communityvisibilitystate: This represents whether the profile is visible or not, and if it is visible, why you are allowed to see it. Note that because this WebAPI does not use authentication, there are only two possible values returned: 1 - the profile is not visible to you (Private, Friends Only, etc), 3 - the profile is "Public", and the data is visible. Mike Blaszczak's post on Steam forums says, "The community visibility state this API returns is different than the privacy state. It's the effective visibility state from the account making the request to the account being viewed given the requesting account's relationship to the viewed account."
- profilestate: If set, indicates the user has a community profile configured (will be set to '1')
- lastlogoff: The last time the user was online, in unix time. Only available when you are friends with the requested user (since Feb, 4).
- commentpermission: If set, indicates the profile allows public comments.
- realname: The player's "Real Name", if they have set it.
- primaryclanid: The player's primary group, as configured in their Steam Community profile.
- timecreated: The time the player's account was created.
- gameid: If the user is currently in-game, this value will be returned and set to the gameid of that game.
- gameserverip: The ip and port of the game server the user is currently playing on, if they are playing on-line in a game using Steam matchmaking. Otherwise will be set to "0.0.0.0:0".
- gameextrainfo: If the user is currently in-game, this will be the name of the game they are playing. This may be the name of a non-Steam game shortcut.
- cityid: This value will be removed in a future update (see loccityid)
- loccountrycode: If set on the user's Steam Community profile, The user's country of residence, 2-character ISO country code
- locstatecode: If set on the user's Steam Community profile, The user's state of residence

- loccityid: An internal code indicating the user's city of residence. A future update will provide this data in a more useful way. steam_location gem/package makes player location data readable for output.

maml:description.maml:para: Query a running steam based game server.

The cmdlet fetches server information from a running game server using UDP/IP packets. It will return information ServerName, Map, InstallDir, GameName, AppID, Players MaxPlayers, Bots, ServerType, Environment, Visibility, VAC andVersion.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the IP address of the Steam based server.
Enter the port number of the Steam based server.
Timeout in milliseconds before giving up querying the server.
Enter the IP address of the Steam based server.
Enter the port number of the Steam based server.
Timeout in milliseconds before giving up querying the server.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author: Jordan Borean, Chris Dent and Frederik Hjorslev Nylander

dev:remarks.maml:para: ``` Protocol : 17 ServerName : SAS Proving Ground 10 (EU) Map : TH-SmallTown InstallDir : groundbranch GameName : Ground Branch AppID : 16900 Players : 6 MaxPlayers : 10 Bots : 0 ServerType : Dedicated Environment : Windows Visibility : Public VAC : Unsecured Version : 1.0.0.0 ExtraDataFlag : 177 IPAddress : 185.15.73.207 Port : 27015 ```

maml:description.maml:para: Install SteamCMD.
This cmdlet downloads SteamCMD and configures it in a custom or predefined location (C:\Program Files\SteamCMD).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifiy the install location of SteamCMD.
The Force parameter allows the user to skip the "Should Continue" box.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifiy the install location of SteamCMD.
The Force parameter allows the user to skip the "Should Continue" box.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Resolve a vanity URL (also named custom URL).
Resolve a vanity URL (also named custom URL) and return the 64 bit SteamID that belongs to said URL.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the vanity URL (also named custom URL) to get a SteamID for. Do not enter the fully qualified URL, but just the ID e.g. hjorslev instead of "https://steamcommunity.com/id/hjorslev/"
The type of vanity URL. 1 (default): Individual profile, 2: Group, 3: Official game group
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.
Enter the vanity URL (also named custom URL) to get a SteamID for. Do not enter the fully qualified URL, but just the ID e.g. hjorslev instead of "https://steamcommunity.com/id/hjorslev/"
The type of vanity URL. 1 (default): Individual profile, 2: Group, 3: Official game group
Format of the output. Options are json (default), xml or vdf.

maml:description.maml:para: Install or update a Steam application using SteamCMD.
Install or update a Steam application using SteamCMD. If SteamCMD is missing, it will be installed first. You can either search for the application by name or enter the specific Application ID.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the name of the app to make a wildcard search for the application.
Path to installation folder.
If the app requires login to install or update, enter your Steam username and password.
Enter any additional arguments here.
Beware, the following arguments are already used:
If you use Steam login to install/upload the app the following arguments are already used: "+login $SteamUserName $SteamPassword +force_install_dir $Path +app_update $SteamAppID $Arguments +quit"
If you use anonymous login to install/upload the app the following arguments are already used: "+login anonymous +force_install_dir $Path +app_update $SteamAppID $Arguments +quit"
The Force parameter allows the user to skip the "Should Continue" box.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Enter the application ID you wish to install.
Path to installation folder.
If the app requires login to install or update, enter your Steam username and password.
Enter any additional arguments here.
Beware, the following arguments are already used:
If you use Steam login to install/upload the app the following arguments are already used: "+login $SteamUserName $SteamPassword +force_install_dir $Path +app_update $SteamAppID $Arguments +quit"
If you use anonymous login to install/upload the app the following arguments are already used: "+login anonymous +force_install_dir $Path +app_update $SteamAppID $Arguments +quit"
The Force parameter allows the user to skip the "Should Continue" box.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Enter the name of the app to make a wildcard search for the application.
Enter the application ID you wish to install.
Path to installation folder.
If the app requires login to install or update, enter your Steam username and password.
Enter any additional arguments here.
Beware, the following arguments are already used:
If you use Steam login to install/upload the app the following arguments are already used: "+login $SteamUserName $SteamPassword +force_install_dir $Path +app_update $SteamAppID $Arguments +quit"
If you use anonymous login to install/upload the app the following arguments are already used: "+login anonymous +force_install_dir $Path +app_update $SteamAppID $Arguments +quit"
The Force parameter allows the user to skip the "Should Continue" box.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Because there are multiple hits when searching for Arma 3, the user will be promoted to select the right application.
Here we use anonymous login because the particular application (ARK: Survival Evolved Dedicated Server) doesn't require login.

maml:description.maml:para: Update a Steam based game server.
This cmdlet presents a workflow to keep a steam based game server up to date. The server is expecting the game server to be running as a Windows Service.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the application ID you wish to install.
Always receive a notification when a server has been updated. Default is only to send on errors.
Number of times the cmdlet checks if the server is online or offline. When the limit is reached an error is thrown.
Specify the Windows Service Name. You can get a list of services with Get-Service.
Enter the IP address of the Steam based server.
Enter the port number of the Steam based server.
Install location of the game server.
If the app requires login to install or update, enter your Steam username and password.
Enter any additional arguments here.
Specify the directory of the log files.
Enter a Discord Webhook Uri if you wish to get notifications about the server update.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Enter the application ID you wish to install.
Specify the Windows Service Name. You can get a list of services with Get-Service.
Enter the IP address of the Steam based server.
Enter the port number of the Steam based server.
Install location of the game server.
If the app requires login to install or update, enter your Steam username and password.
Enter any additional arguments here.
Specify the directory of the log files.
Enter a Discord Webhook Uri if you wish to get notifications about the server update.
Always receive a notification when a server has been updated. Default is only to send on errors.
Number of times the cmdlet checks if the server is online or offline. When the limit is reached an error is thrown.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
